page.title: 01Upper Donside.
page.content: Glenkindie in the Gordon District is a small village,at the centre of a widely dispersed rural community. It is situated on the A97 and views the River Don which meanders through the scenic and varied Upper Donside valley.Fishing,shooting,hillwalking and nearby ski_ing are established sports.Accommodation includes country hotels,bed and breakfast,self catering homes and caravan/camping park.Salmon & trout are fished from the Don and local burns.Winter ski-ing on the Lecht is ideal for beginners and families. Local castles are Kildrummy(said to be the noblest of Northern castles) & Glenbuchat(ancient seat of the Gordons built in 1590).A plaque outside the public hall shows the site of Towie castle.
